class.name: GDGalaxy
class.brief_description: GOG Galaxy SDK integration for Godot.
class.description:
GDGalaxy provides integration with the GOG Galaxy SDK, allowing games to use GOG Galaxy features such as achievements, statistics, leaderboards, DLC management, and user authentication.
Before using any SDK features, you must call [method Init] to initialize the Galaxy SDK. Make sure to call [method ProcessData] every frame to process callbacks from the SDK.

method.name: ClearAchievement
method.description: Clears an achievement. This marks it as locked again. In order to make this change persistent, call [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: FindLeaderboard
method.description: Performs a request for the definition of a specific leaderboard. This is an asynchronous call. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_retrieve_failure] signals. After retrieving the definition, you can read metadata with [method GetLeaderboardDisplayName], [method GetLeaderboardSortMethod], or [method GetLeaderboardDisplayType].

method.name: FindOrCreateLeaderboard
method.description: Performs a request for the definition of a specific leaderboard, or creates it if it doesn't exist. This is an asynchronous call. The [code]sortMethod[/code] parameter should be one of [enum LeaderboardSortMethod] values. The [code]displayType[/code] parameter should be one of [enum LeaderboardDisplayType] values. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_retrieve_failure] signals.

method.name: GetAchievement
method.description: Reads the state of a specified achievement. Returns a dictionary containing: - [code]success[/code]: Boolean indicating if the operation was successful - [code]isUnlocked[/code]: Boolean indicating whether the achievement has been unlocked - [code]unlockTime[/code]: Unix timestamp of when the achievement was unlocked (0 if not unlocked) Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: GetAchievementDescription
method.description: Returns the description of the specified achievement. The description provides details about what the player needs to do to unlock the achievement. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: GetAchievementDisplayName
method.description: Returns the display name of the specified achievement. The display name is the human-readable title shown to players, as configured in the GOG Galaxy Developer Portal. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: GetCurrentGameLanguage
method.description: Returns the current game language for the given product ID. Language name is returned in lowercase, e.g., "english", "polish". The [code]product_id[/code] parameter is the ID of the game or DLC to check. Zero (default) means the base game itself.

method.name: GetCurrentGameLanguageCode
method.description: Returns the current game language code for the given product ID. Language code consists of ISO-639 language code and ISO-3166 country code, e.g., "en-US", "pl-PL". The [code]product_id[/code] parameter is the ID of the game or DLC to check. Zero (default) means the base game itself.

method.name: GetError
method.description: Returns information about the last error that occurred in the SDK. The returned dictionary contains error details including error type and message.

method.name: GetGalaxyID
method.description: Returns the Galaxy ID of the currently signed-in user. This method only works if the user is successfully signed in via [method SignInGalaxy].

method.name: GetLeaderboardDisplayName
method.description: Returns the display name of the specified leaderboard. Retrieve the leaderboard definition first by calling [method FindLeaderboard], [method FindOrCreateLeaderboard], or [method RequestLeaderboards].

method.name: GetLeaderboardDisplayType
method.description: Returns the display type of the specified leaderboard as a [enum LeaderboardDisplayType] value. Retrieve the leaderboard definition first by calling [method FindLeaderboard], [method FindOrCreateLeaderboard], or [method RequestLeaderboards].

method.name: GetLeaderboardEntryCount
method.description: Returns the number of entries retrieved for the specified leaderboard. Call one of the RequestLeaderboardEntries methods first to retrieve entries.

method.name: GetLeaderboardSortMethod
method.description: Returns the sort method of the specified leaderboard as a [enum LeaderboardSortMethod] value. Retrieve the leaderboard definition first by calling [method FindLeaderboard], [method FindOrCreateLeaderboard], or [method RequestLeaderboards].

method.name: GetRequestedLeaderboardEntry
method.description: Returns a leaderboard entry at the specified index from the most recently retrieved leaderboard entries. The index is in the range [0, entry count). Use [method GetLeaderboardEntryCount] to get the number of available entries. Call one of the RequestLeaderboardEntries methods first to retrieve entries.

method.name: GetRequestedLeaderboardEntryWithDetails
method.description: Returns a leaderboard entry with additional details at the specified index from the most recently retrieved leaderboard entries. The details include any extra data that was attached to the score when it was set using [method SetLeaderboardScoreWithDetails]. The index is in the range [0, entry count). Use [method GetLeaderboardEntryCount] to get the number of available entries.

method.name: GetStatFloat
method.description: Reads the floating point value of a statistic for the current user. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the code name of the statistic. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: GetStatInt
method.description: Reads the integer value of a statistic for the current user. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the code name of the statistic. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: GetUserTimePlayed
method.description: Returns the time played (in seconds) for the specified user. Call [method RequestUserTimePlayed] first to retrieve this information.

method.name: Init
method.description: Call this before running any queries to GOG. Returns true if successful, false if init failed. If Init failed, some SDK functions are inacessible.

method.name: IsAchievementVisible
method.description: Returns whether the specified achievement is visible to the user. Some achievements can be configured as hidden until certain conditions are met. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: IsAchievementVisibleWhileLocked
method.description: Returns whether the specified achievement is visible before it's unlocked. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: IsDlcInstalled
method.description: Checks if the specified DLC is installed. The [code]product_id[/code] parameter is the Product ID of the DLC to check. Returns [code]true[/code] if the DLC is installed, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: IsDlcOwned
method.description: Check if user has license for specified DLC. This is an asynchronious call. The [code]product_id[/code] parameter is the Product ID of the DLC to check. Responses come to the [signal on_dlc_check_success] or [signal on_dlc_check_failure] signals.

method.name: IsLoggedOn
method.description: Checks if the user is logged on to Galaxy backend services. Only a user that has been successfully signed in within Galaxy Service can be logged on to Galaxy backend services. A user that is logged on is also signed in, and a user that is not signed in is also not logged on.

method.name: ProcessData
method.description: Call this every frame. This is an equivalent to Steam's callbacks processing

method.name: RequestLeaderboardEntriesArroundUser
method.description: Performs a request for leaderboard entries for and near the specified user. This is an asynchronous call. The [code]countBefore[/code] and [code]countAfter[/code] parameters are treated as hints. If the requested range would go beyond the set of all leaderboard entries, it is shifted to fit while preserving its size if possible. The [code]userId[/code] parameter can be omitted (0) to request for the current user. This call will fail if there is no entry for the specified user in the leaderboard. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_failure] signals.

method.name: RequestLeaderboardEntriesForUsers
method.description: Performs a request for leaderboard entries for specific users. This is an asynchronous call. The [code]userIds[/code] parameter is an array of Galaxy user IDs for which to retrieve entries. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_failure] signals.

method.name: RequestLeaderboardEntriesGlobal
method.description: Performs a request for leaderboard entries in a global scope, without focusing on specific users. This is an asynchronous call. The entries are indexed from 0. The [code]rangeStart[/code] parameter is the index of the first entry to retrieve, and [code]rangeEnd[/code] is the index of the last entry to retrieve (inclusive). Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_failure] signals. After successful retrieval, use [method GetRequestedLeaderboardEntry] to read individual entries.

method.name: RequestLeaderboards
method.description: Performs a request for definitions of all leaderboards. This is an asynchronous call. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboards_retrieve_success] or [signal on_leaderboards_retrieve_failure] signals. After successful retrieval, you can read metadata with [method GetLeaderboardDisplayName], [method GetLeaderboardSortMethod], or [method GetLeaderboardDisplayType].

method.name: RequestUserStatsAndAchievements
method.description: Performs a request to retrieve statistics and achievements for the current user. This is an asynchronous call. After signing in, you should call this method to retrieve information about achievements and statistics before using any Get/Set methods for stats and achievements. Responses come to the [signal on_user_stats_and_achievements_retrieve_success] or [signal on_user_stats_and_achievements_retrieve_failure] signals.

method.name: RequestUserTimePlayed
method.description: Performs a request to retrieve the time played for a specific user. This is an asynchronous call. Responses come to the [signal on_user_time_played_retrieve_success] or [signal on_user_time_played_retrieve_failure] signals. After successful retrieval, use [method GetUserTimePlayed] to read the time played value.

method.name: ResetStatsAndAchievements
method.description: Resets all statistics and achievements to their initial values. This is an asynchronous call. This is equivalent to setting statistics and achievements to their initial values and calling [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Responses come to the [signal on_stats_and_achievements_store_success] or [signal on_stats_and_achievements_store_failure] signals.

method.name: SetAchievement
method.description: Unlocks an achievement. The achievement is marked as unlocked at the time this method is called. In order to make this change persistent, call [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: SetLeaderboardScore
method.description: Sets a score in the specified leaderboard. This is an asynchronous call. If [code]forceUpdate[/code] is false, the score will only be updated if it's better than the previous score (according to the leaderboard's sort method). If [code]forceUpdate[/code] is true, the score will always be updated regardless of whether it's an improvement. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_score_update_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_score_update_failure] signals.

method.name: SetLeaderboardScoreWithDetails
method.description: Sets a score with additional details in the specified leaderboard. This is an asynchronous call. The [code]details[/code] parameter can contain arbitrary binary data to attach to the score (e.g., replay data or metadata). If [code]forceUpdate[/code] is false, the score will only be updated if it's better than the previous score. If [code]forceUpdate[/code] is true, the score will always be updated regardless of whether it's an improvement. Responses come to the [signal on_leaderboard_score_update_success] or [signal on_leaderboard_score_update_failure] signals.

method.name: SetStatFloat
method.description: Updates a statistic with a floating point value. In order to make this change persistent, call [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: SetStatInt
method.description: Updates a statistic with an integer value. In order to make this change persistent, call [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

method.name: Shutdown
method.description: Shuts down the Galaxy SDK and releases all resources. Call this when your game is closing or when you no longer need the SDK. All pending asynchronous operations will be finished immediately.

method.name: SignInGalaxy
method.description: Starts a connection with GOG Galaxy. Make sure to call Init() first and provide clientId and clientSecret in project settings

method.name: SignOut
method.description: Sign out from the SDK

method.name: SignedIn
method.description: Returns true if successfully SignedIn into the SDK

method.name: StoreStatsAndAchievements
method.description: Persists all changes to statistics and achievements to the backend. This is an asynchronous call. After modifying statistics with [method SetStatInt] or [method SetStatFloat], or unlocking achievements with [method SetAchievement], call this method to save changes. Responses come to the [signal on_stats_and_achievements_store_success] or [signal on_stats_and_achievements_store_failure] signals. Notifications about unlocking achievements come to the achievement change listeners.

method.name: UpdateAvgRateStat
method.description: Updates an average-rate statistic with a delta. The [code]countThisSession[/code] parameter is the delta of the count, and [code]sessionLength[/code] is the delta of the session time. This is useful for tracking rates like "kills per hour" or "distance per minute". In order to make this change persistent, call [method StoreStatsAndAchievements]. Call [method RequestUserStatsAndAchievements] first for this to work.

signal.name: on_auth_failure
signal.description: Emitted when authentication fails. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum AuthFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_auth_lost
signal.description: Emitted when authentication is lost after successfully signing in. This can occur due to networking issues or limited availability of Galaxy backend services. You will need to sign in again for the SDK to operate properly.

signal.name: on_auth_success
signal.description: Emitted when authentication is successful. After this signal, you can use SDK features that require authentication.

signal.name: on_dlc_check_failure
signal.description: Emitted when checking DLC ownership fails. The [code]productId[/code] parameter is the Product ID of the DLC that was queried. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum IsDlcOwnedFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_dlc_check_success
signal.description: Emitted when DLC ownership check succeeds. The [code]productId[/code] parameter is the Product ID of the DLC that was queried. The [code]isOwned[/code] parameter indicates whether the user owns the DLC.

signal.name: on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_failure
signal.description: Emitted when retrieving leaderboard entries fails. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum LeaderboardEntriesRetrieveFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_leaderboard_entries_retrieve_success
signal.description: Emitted when leaderboard entries are successfully retrieved. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. The [code]entriesCount[/code] parameter is the number of entries that were retrieved. Use [method GetRequestedLeaderboardEntry] to read individual entries.

signal.name: on_leaderboard_retrieve_failure
signal.description: Emitted when retrieving a leaderboard definition fails. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. The [code]reason[/code] parameter indicates the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_leaderboard_retrieve_success
signal.description: Emitted when a leaderboard definition is successfully retrieved. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. You can now read metadata with [method GetLeaderboardDisplayName], [method GetLeaderboardSortMethod], or [method GetLeaderboardDisplayType].

signal.name: on_leaderboard_score_update_failure
signal.description: Emitted when setting a leaderboard score fails. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. The [code]score[/code] parameter is the score that was attempted to set. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum LeaderboardScoreUpdateFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_leaderboard_score_update_success
signal.description: Emitted when a leaderboard score is successfully updated. The [code]name[/code] parameter is the name of the leaderboard. The [code]score[/code] parameter is the score after the update. The [code]oldRank[/code] parameter is the previous rank (0 if the user had no entry yet). The [code]newRank[/code] parameter is the current rank after the update.

signal.name: on_leaderboards_retrieve_failure
signal.description: Emitted when retrieving all leaderboard definitions fails. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum LeaderboardsRetrieveFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_leaderboards_retrieve_success
signal.description: Emitted when all leaderboard definitions are successfully retrieved. You can now read metadata for any leaderboard with [method GetLeaderboardDisplayName], [method GetLeaderboardSortMethod], or [method GetLeaderboardDisplayType].

signal.name: on_stats_and_achievements_store_failure
signal.description: Emitted when storing statistics and achievements fails. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum StatsAndAchievementsStoreFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_stats_and_achievements_store_success
signal.description: Emitted when statistics and achievements are successfully stored. All local changes to statistics and achievements have been persisted to the backend.

signal.name: on_user_stats_and_achievements_retrieve_failure
signal.description: Emitted when retrieving user statistics and achievements fails. The [code]userID[/code] parameter is the Galaxy ID of the user. The [code]reason[/code] parameter is one of [enum UserStatsAndAchievementsRetrieveFailureReason] values indicating the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_user_stats_and_achievements_retrieve_success
signal.description: Emitted when user statistics and achievements are successfully retrieved. The [code]userID[/code] parameter is the Galaxy ID of the user. You can now read statistics with [method GetStatInt] or [method GetStatFloat], and achievements with [method GetAchievement].

signal.name: on_user_time_played_retrieve_failure
signal.description: Emitted when retrieving user time played fails. The [code]userID[/code] parameter is the Galaxy ID of the user. The [code]reason[/code] parameter indicates the cause of the failure.

signal.name: on_user_time_played_retrieve_success
signal.description: Emitted when user time played is successfully retrieved. The [code]userID[/code] parameter is the Galaxy ID of the user. Use [method GetUserTimePlayed] to read the time played value.

constants.constant: Undefined error occurred during authentication.
Galaxy Service is not installed properly or fails to start.
Galaxy Service is not signed in properly.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
User that is being signed in has no license for this application.
Unable to match client credentials (ID, secret) or user credentials (username, password).
Galaxy has not been initialized.
Unable to communicate with external service.
Undefined error occurred while checking DLC ownership.
Galaxy Service is not signed in properly.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
Unable to communicate with external service.
Unspecified error occurred while retrieving achievements and statistics.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
Unspecified error occurred while storing achievements and statistics.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
Unspecified error occurred while retrieving leaderboards.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
Unspecified error occurred while retrieving leaderboard entries.
Could not find any entries for the specified search criteria.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
Unspecified error occurred while updating leaderboard score.
Previous score was better and the update operation was not forced.
Unable to communicate with backend services.
No sorting method specified.
Top score is the lowest number (ascending order).
Top score is the highest number (descending order).
No display type specified.
Simple numerical score.
The score represents time, in milliseconds.
The score represents time, in seconds.
